entry.title: Armenian officials shield travel expenses despite European calls for transparency

media:group.media:title: Armenian officials shield travel expenses despite European calls for transparency
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian parliament speaker says no threat of Moscow-backed coup. üìç Former president Serzh Sargsyan calls for government change, emphasizing the role of law enforcement in the process. üìç Armenia is moving from Russian to NATO-standard artillery in a strategic effort to diversify its defense partners and reduce dependency on Moscow. üìç The Armenian government faces criticism for continuing to hide top officials' expenses despite anti-corruption warnings from a European oversight body.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Armenia issues new government bonds as borrowing increases: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia issues new government bonds as borrowing increases: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs economic activity index, a government indicator that corresponds roughly to economic growth, saw a 4.1% year-on-year increase in the first quarter of 2025. üìç The operator of Armenia‚Äôs Amulsar gold mine will take a $150 million loan from Ameriabank, one of the country‚Äôs largest lenders, in a major funding shakeup. üìç The Armenian government issued more than $256 million worth of bonds on the domestic stock exchange, a sign of increasing borrowing to fight a growing national debt. üìç Inside the World Bank‚Äôs new strategy for Armenia: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7G2Tp6-sPoE

entry.title: Armenia yet to apply for EU membership, European official says

media:group.media:title: Armenia yet to apply for EU membership, European official says
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia remains the freest country for the press in the South Caucasus and one of the best in the entire former Soviet Union, Reporters Without Borders indicated in the latest edition of its yearly World Press Freedom Index. üìçThe European Union has not received a formal application for membership from Armenia, EU Enlargement Commissioner Marta Kos said. üìçBaku‚Äôs Vatican ‚Äòpriestitutes‚Äô

media:group.media:title: Baku‚Äôs Vatican ‚Äòpriestitutes‚Äô
media:group.media:description:
This week‚Äôs episode of Insights examines the Vatican‚Äôs recent hosting of a propaganda event orchestrated by the Azerbaijani regime- part of a broader effort by Baku to erase Armenian heritage in Artsakh. Host Eric Hacopian gives recommendations on how to confront and dismantle Baku‚Äôs global lobbying machine, built on corruption, co-opted institutions, and the rebranding of ethnic cleansing. The episode concludes with a breakdown of the Trump administration‚Äôs refusal to use the word ‚Äúgenocide‚Äù in the April 24 commemoration statement.
